Initiating Documentary Design
I'm starting to formulate a basic plan for the nature documentary. Right now, I'm thinking about the audience and broad topic. My next step will be to flesh out the predicted details. I'll need to confirm these elements with you for a more tailored approach.
Refining Initial Proposals
I've laid out the plan based on the user's input: a nature documentary targeting a general audience. The video will be approximately 15 seconds long with a cinematic theme, in portrait orientation. The plan also includes an avatar of a male presenter in his 40s dressed as a park ranger, with a deep, calming voice. I'm preparing to present this to the user for feedback.
Creating Detailed Proposals
Okay, I've outlined the plan, detailing the topic, audience, music, video length, orientation, script creation, language, avatar, voice, supplemental footage, and captions. I'm formatting it into a table now, ready for you to review. After that, I will directly ask if you are ready to proceed with these predicted details.

I've also updated the voice selection to match the new avatar, choosing a warm, calming female voice. The rest of the plan remains the same. The updated plan is ready for confirmation.
Finalizing the Presentation
